content: What narrow strip of land, also the name of an ancient city-state, connects mainland Greece with the Peloponnese peninsula?

The narrow strip of land that connects mainland Greece with the Peloponnese peninsula is called the Isthmus of Corinth. Additionally, an ancient city-state with a similar name was Corinth itself, which was located on this isthmus. So, the answer to your question is the Isthmus of Corinth, and the ancient city-state is Corinth.
